intro: Sachsia coronopifolia, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has a low, sprawling growth habit with gray-green, succulent leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and small, narrow leaves that are covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Sachsia coronopifolia is well adapted to drought and full sun, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
